tags.name: openapi
tags.description: methods that query for generated OpenAPI specifications

get.summary: get all Slurm tracked license info

post.summary: submit new job allocation without any steps that must be signaled to stop

get.description: This endpoint may return multiple job entries since job_id is not a unique key - only the tuple (cluster, job_id, start_time) is unique. If the requested job_id is a component of a heterogeneous job all components are returned.

requestBody.description: TRES descriptions. Only works in developer mode.

parameters.description: Do not truncate the time to usage_start and usage_end

parameters.name: node
parameters.description: Ranged node string where jobs ran

level.description: Fairshare factor at this level; stored on an assoc as a long double, but that is not needed for display in sshare

set.description: True if number has been set; False if number is unset

infinite.description: True if number has been set to infinite; "set" and "number" will be ignored

number.description: If "set" is True the number will be set with value; otherwise ignore number contents

set.description: True if number has been set; False if number is unset

infinite.description: True if number has been set to infinite; "set" and "number" will be ignored

number.description: If "set" is True the number will be set with value; otherwise ignore number contents

set.description: True if number has been set; False if number is unset

infinite.description: True if number has been set to infinite; "set" and "number" will be ignored

number.description: If "set" is True the number will be set with value; otherwise ignore number contents

source.description: Source of error or where error was first detected
Source of warning or where warning was first detected

parts_packed.description: Zero if only RPC statistic included

req_time.description: When the request was made (UNIX timestamp)

req_time_start.description: When the data in the report started (UNIX timestamp)

server_thread_count.description: Number of current active slurmctld threads

agent_queue_size.description: Number of enqueued outgoing RPC requests in an internal retry list

agent_thread_count.description: Total number of active threads created by all agent threads

dbd_agent_queue_size.description: Number of messages for SlurmDBD that are queued

gettimeofday_latency.description: Latency of 1000 calls to the gettimeofday() syscall in microseconds, as measured at controller startup

schedule_cycle_max.description: Max time of any scheduling cycle in microseconds since last reset

schedule_cycle_last.description: Time in microseconds for last scheduling cycle

schedule_cycle_sum.description: Total run time in microseconds for all scheduling cycles since last reset

schedule_cycle_total.description: Number of scheduling cycles since last reset

schedule_cycle_mean.description: Mean time in microseconds for all scheduling cycles since last reset

schedule_cycle_mean_depth.description: Mean of the number of jobs processed in a scheduling cycle

schedule_cycle_per_minute.description: Number of scheduling executions per minute

schedule_cycle_depth.description: Total number of jobs processed in scheduling cycles

schedule_exit.description: Reasons for which the scheduling cycle exited since last reset

schedule_queue_length.description: Number of jobs pending in queue

jobs_submitted.description: Number of jobs submitted since last reset

jobs_started.description: Number of jobs started since last reset

jobs_completed.description: Number of jobs completed since last reset

jobs_canceled.description: Number of jobs canceled since the last reset

jobs_failed.description: Number of jobs failed due to slurmd or other internal issues since last reset

jobs_pending.description: Number of jobs pending at the time of listed in job_state_ts

jobs_running.description: Number of jobs running at the time of listed in job_state_ts

job_states_ts.description: When the job state counts were gathered (UNIX timestamp)

bf_backfilled_jobs.description: Number of jobs started through backfilling since last slurm start

bf_last_backfilled_jobs.description: Number of jobs started through backfilling since last reset

bf_backfilled_het_jobs.description: Number of heterogeneous job components started through backfilling since last Slurm start

bf_cycle_counter.description: Number of backfill scheduling cycles since last reset

bf_cycle_mean.description: Mean time in microseconds of backfilling scheduling cycles since last reset

bf_depth_mean.description: Mean number of eligible to run jobs processed during all backfilling scheduling cycles since last reset

bf_depth_mean_try.description: The subset of Depth Mean that the backfill scheduler attempted to schedule

bf_cycle_sum.description: Total time in microseconds of backfilling scheduling cycles since last reset

bf_cycle_last.description: Execution time in microseconds of last backfill scheduling cycle

bf_cycle_max.description: Execution time in microseconds of longest backfill scheduling cycle

bf_exit.description: Reasons for which the backfill scheduling cycle exited since last reset

bf_last_depth.description: Number of processed jobs during last backfilling scheduling cycle

bf_last_depth_try.description: Number of processed jobs during last backfilling scheduling cycle that had a chance to start using available resources

bf_depth_sum.description: Total number of jobs processed during all backfilling scheduling cycles since last reset

bf_depth_try_sum.description: Subset of bf_depth_sum that the backfill scheduler attempted to schedule

bf_queue_len.description: Number of jobs pending to be processed by backfilling algorithm

bf_queue_len_mean.description: Mean number of jobs pending to be processed by backfilling algorithm

bf_queue_len_sum.description: Total number of jobs pending to be processed by backfilling algorithm since last reset

bf_table_size.description: Number of different time slots tested by the backfill scheduler in its last iteration

bf_table_size_sum.description: Total number of different time slots tested by the backfill scheduler

bf_table_size_mean.description: Mean number of different time slots tested by the backfill scheduler

bf_when_last_cycle.description: When the last backfill scheduling cycle happened (UNIX timestamp)

rpcs_by_message_type.description: Most frequently issued remote procedure calls (RPCs)

default_queue_depth.description: Reached number of jobs allowed to be tested

max_job_start.description: Reached number of jobs allowed to start

bf_max_job_start.description: Reached number of jobs allowed to start

bf_max_job_test.description: Reached number of jobs allowed to be tested

cycle_last.description: Number of RPCs processed within the last RPC queue cycle

cycle_max.description: Maximum number of RPCs processed within a RPC queue cycle since start

total_time.description: Total time spent processing RPC in seconds

average_time.description: Average time spent processing RPC in seconds

total_time.description: Total time spent processing RPC in seconds

average_time.description: Average time spent processing RPC in seconds

responding.description: If ping RPC responded with pong from controller

latency.description: Number of microseconds it took to successfully ping or timeout

mode.description: The operating mode of the responding slurmctld

primary.description: Is responding slurmctld the primary controller

last_update.description: Time of last licenses change (UNIX timestamp)

Remote.description: Indicates whether licenses are served by the database

LastConsumed.description: Last known number of licenses that were consumed in the license manager (Remote Only)

LastDeficit.description: Number of "missing licenses" from the cluster's perspective

LastUpdate.description: When the license information was last updated (UNIX Timestamp)

script.description: Deprecated; Populate script field in jobs[0] or job

account_gather_frequency.description: Job accounting and profiling sampling intervals in seconds

allocation_node_list.description: Local node making the resource allocation

allocation_node_port.description: Port to send allocation confirmation to

argv.description: Arguments to the script. Note: The slurmstepd always overrides argv[0] with the path to the created script file. If this option is used, argv[0] should be a throwaway value.

batch_features.description: Features required for batch script's node

begin_time.description: Defer the allocation of the job until the specified time (UNIX timestamp)

clusters.description: Clusters that a federated job can run on

cluster_constraint.description: Required features that a federated cluster must have to have a sibling job submitted to it

contiguous.description: True if job requires contiguous nodes

container.description: Absolute path to OCI container bundle

cpu_binding.description: Method for binding tasks to allocated CPUs

cpus_per_tres.description: Semicolon delimited list of TRES=# values values indicating how many CPUs should be allocated for each specified TRES (currently only used for gres/gpu)

deadline.description: Latest time that the job may start (UNIX timestamp)

delay_boot.description: Number of seconds after job eligible start that nodes will be rebooted to satisfy feature specification

dependency.description: Other jobs that must meet certain criteria before this job can start

environment.description: Environment variables to be set for the job

fsize.description: Largest file that can be created, in bytes

data.description: Maximum size of data segment, in bytes

stack.description: Maximum size of stack segment, in bytes

core.description: Largest core file that can be created, in bytes

rss.description: Largest resident set size, in bytes. This affects swapping; processes that are exceeding their resident set size will be more likely to have physical memory taken from them

excluded_nodes.description: Comma separated list of nodes that may not be used

extra.description: Arbitrary string used for node filtering if extra constraints are enabled

constraints.description: Comma separated list of features that are required

group_id.description: Group ID of the user that owns the job

hetjob_group.description: Unique sequence number applied to this component of the heterogeneous job

immediate.description: If true, exit if resources are not available within the time period specified

kill_on_node_fail.description: If true, kill job on node failure

mcs_label.description: Multi-Category Security label on the job

memory_binding_type.description: Method for binding tasks to memory

memory_per_tres.description: Semicolon delimited list of TRES=# values indicating how much memory in megabytes should be allocated for each specified TRES (currently only used for gres/gpu)

oom_kill_step.description: Kill whole step in case of OOM in one of the tasks

open_mode.description: Open mode used for stdout and stderr files

reserve_ports.description: Port to send various notification msg to

distribution_plane_size.description: Plane size specification when distribution specifies plane

prefer.description: Comma separated list of features that are preferred but not required

profile.description: Profile used by the acct_gather_profile plugin

qos.description: Quality of Service assigned to the job

required_nodes.description: Comma separated list of required nodes

requeue.description: Determines whether the job may be requeued

script.description: Job batch script; only the first component in a HetJob is populated or honored

shared.description: How the job can share resources with other jobs, if at all

spank_environment.description: Environment variables for job prolog/epilog scripts as set by SPANK plugins

tres_per_job.description: Comma separated list of TRES=# values to be allocated for every job

tres_per_node.description: Comma separated list of TRES=# values to be allocated for every node

tres_per_socket.description: Comma separated list of TRES=# values to be allocated for every socket

tres_per_task.description: Comma separated list of TRES=# values to be allocated for every task

user_id.description: User ID that owns the job

wait_all_nodes.description: If true, wait to start until after all nodes have booted

kill_warning_signal.description: Signal to send when approaching end time (e.g. "10" or "USR1")

kill_warning_delay.description: Number of seconds before end time to send the warning signal

current_working_directory.description: Working directory to use for the job

cpus_per_task.description: Number of CPUs required by each task

tasks_per_node.description: Number of tasks to invoke on each node

tasks_per_socket.description: Number of tasks to invoke on each socket

tasks_per_core.description: Number of tasks to invoke on each core

tasks_per_board.description: Number of tasks to invoke on each board

ntasks_per_tres.description: Number of tasks that can access each GPU

minimum_cpus_per_node.description: Minimum number of CPUs per node

memory_per_cpu.description: Minimum memory in megabytes per allocated CPU

memory_per_node.description: Minimum memory in megabytes per allocated node

temporary_disk_per_node.description: Minimum tmp disk space required per node

wait_for_switch.description: Maximum time to wait for switches in seconds

x11_target_host.description: Hostname or UNIX socket if x11_target_port=0

minute.description: Ranged string specifying eligible minute values (e.g. 0-10,50)

hour.description: Ranged string specifying eligible hour values (e.g. 0-5,23)

day_of_month.description: Ranged string specifying eligible day of month values (e.g. 0-10,29)

month.description: Ranged string specifying eligible month values (e.g. 0-5,12)

day_of_week.description: Ranged string specifying eligible day of week values (e.g.0-3,7)

specification.description: Complete time specification (* means valid for all allowed values) - minute hour day_of_month month day_of_week

start.description: Start of this entry in file

end.description: End of this entry in file

set.description: True if number has been set; False if number is unset

infinite.description: True if number has been set to infinite; "set" and "number" will be ignored

number.description: If "set" is True the number will be set with value; otherwise ignore number contents

last_backfill.description: Time of last backfill scheduler run (UNIX timestamp)

last_update.description: Time of last job change (UNIX timestamp)

accrue_time.description: When the job started accruing age priority (UNIX timestamp)

allocating_node.description: Local node making the resource allocation

array_job_id.description: Job ID of job array, or 0 if N/A

array_task_id.description: Task ID of this task in job array

array_max_tasks.description: Maximum number of simultaneously running array tasks, 0 if no limit

array_task_string.description: String expression of task IDs in this record

batch_features.description: Features required for batch script's node

batch_host.description: Name of host running batch script

container.description: Absolute path to OCI container bundle

contiguous.description: True if job requires contiguous nodes

cpus_per_task.description: Number of CPUs required by each task

cpus_per_tres.description: Semicolon delimited list of TRES=# values indicating how many CPUs should be allocated for each specified TRES (currently only used for gres/gpu)

deadline.description: Latest time that the job may start (UNIX timestamp)

delay_boot.description: Number of seconds after job eligible start that nodes will be rebooted to satisfy feature specification

dependency.description: Other jobs that must meet certain criteria before this job can start

derived_exit_code.description: Highest exit code of all job steps

eligible_time.description: Time when the job became eligible to run (UNIX timestamp)

end_time.description: End time, real or expected (UNIX timestamp)

excluded_nodes.description: Comma separated list of nodes that may not be used

extra.description: Arbitrary string used for node filtering if extra constraints are enabled

failed_node.description: Name of node that caused job failure

features.description: Comma separated list of features that are required

gres_detail.description: List of GRES index and counts allocated per node

group_id.description: Group ID of the user that owns the job

group_name.description: Group name of the user that owns the job

het_job_id_set.description: Job ID range for all heterogeneous job components

het_job_offset.description: Unique sequence number applied to this component of the heterogeneous job

job_size_str.description: Number of nodes (in a range) required for this job

last_sched_evaluation.description: Last time job was evaluated for scheduling (UNIX timestamp)

max_cpus.description: Maximum number of CPUs usable by the job

max_nodes.description: Maximum number of nodes usable by the job

mcs_label.description: Multi-Category Security label on the job

memory_per_tres.description: Semicolon delimited list of TRES=# values indicating how much memory in megabytes should be allocated for each specified TRES (currently only used for gres/gpu)

tasks_per_core.description: Number of tasks invoked on each core

tasks_per_tres.description: Number of tasks that can assess each GPU

tasks_per_node.description: Number of tasks invoked on each node

tasks_per_socket.description: Number of tasks invoked on each socket

tasks_per_board.description: Number of tasks invoked on each board

prefer.description: Feature(s) the job requested but that are not required

memory_per_cpu.description: Minimum memory in megabytes per allocated CPU

memory_per_node.description: Minimum memory in megabytes per allocated node

minimum_cpus_per_node.description: Minimum number of CPUs per node

minimum_tmp_disk_per_node.description: Minimum tmp disk space required per node

preempt_time.description: Time job received preemption signal (UNIX timestamp)

preemptable_time.description: Time job becomes eligible for preemption (UNIX timestamp)

pre_sus_time.description: Total run time prior to last suspend in seconds

priority_by_partition.description: Prospective job priority in each partition that may be used by this job

profile.description: Profile used by the acct_gather_profile plugin

qos.description: Quality of Service assigned to the job, if pending the QOS requested

required_nodes.description: Comma separated list of required nodes

requeue.description: Determines whether the job may be requeued

resize_time.description: Time of last size change (UNIX timestamp)

scheduled_nodes.description: List of nodes scheduled to be used for the job

shared.description: How the job can share resources with other jobs, if at all

sockets_per_board.description: Number of sockets per board required

sockets_per_node.description: Number of sockets per node required

start_time.description: Time execution began, or is expected to begin (UNIX timestamp)

state_reason.description: Reason for current Pending or Failed state

submit_time.description: Time when the job was submitted (UNIX timestamp)

suspend_time.description: Time the job was last suspended or resumed (UNIX timestamp)

threads_per_core.description: Number of processor threads per CPU core required

tres_per_job.description: Comma separated list of TRES=# values to be allocated per job

tres_per_node.description: Comma separated list of TRES=# values to be allocated per node

tres_per_socket.description: Comma separated list of TRES=# values to be allocated per socket

tres_per_task.description: Comma separated list of TRES=# values to be allocated per task

user_id.description: User ID that owns the job

user_name.description: User name that owns the job

maximum_switch_wait_time.description: Maximum time to wait for switches in seconds

current_working_directory.description: Working directory to use for the job

threads_per_core.description: Number of processor threads per CPU core

count.description: Total number of CPUs assigned to job

used.description: Total number of CPUs used by job

priority.description: Prospective job priority if it runs in this partition

message.description: Error message why signaling job failed

step_id.description: Job or Step ID that signaling failed

sibling.description: Name of federation sibling (may be empty for non-federation)

account.description: Filter jobs to a specific account

job_name.description: Filter jobs to a specific name

partition.description: Filter jobs to a specific partition

qos.description: Filter jobs to a specific QOS

reservation.description: Filter jobs to a specific reservation

job_state.description: Filter jobs to a specific state

user_id.description: Filter jobs to a specific numeric user id

user_name.description: Filter jobs to a specific user name

wckey.description: Filter jobs to a specific wckey

nodes.description: Filter jobs to a set of nodes

last_update.description: Time of last node change (UNIX timestamp)

burstbuffer_network_address.description: Alternate network path to be used for sbcast network traffic

boards.description: Number of Baseboards in nodes with a baseboard controller

boot_time.description: Time when the node booted (UNIX timestamp)

cluster_name.description: Cluster name (only set in federated environments)

cores.description: Number of cores in a single physical processor socket

specialized_cores.description: Number of cores reserved for system use

cpu_binding.description: Default method for binding tasks to allocated CPUs

cpu_load.description: CPU load as reported by the OS

free_mem.description: Total memory in MB currently free as reported by the OS

cpus.description: Total CPUs, including cores and threads

effective_cpus.description: Number of effective CPUs (excluding specialized CPUs)

specialized_cpus.description: Abstract CPU IDs on this node reserved for exclusive use by slurmd and slurmstepd

extra.description: Arbitrary string used for node filtering if extra constraints are enabled

gpu_spec.description: CPU cores reserved for jobs that also use a GPU

last_busy.description: Time when the node was last busy (UNIX timestamp)

specialized_memory.description: Combined memory limit, in MB, for Slurm compute node daemons

next_state_after_reboot.description: The state the node will be assigned after rebooting

address.description: NodeAddr, used to establish a communication path

state.description: Node state(s) applicable to this node

operating_system.description: Operating system reported by the node

owner.description: User allowed to run jobs on this node (unset if no restriction)

port.description: TCP port number of the slurmd

real_memory.description: Total memory in MB on the node

res_cores_per_gpu.description: Number of CPU cores per GPU restricted to GPU jobs

reason.description: Describes why the node is in a "DOWN", "DRAINED", "DRAINING", "FAILING" or "FAIL" state

resume_after.description: Number of seconds after the node's state is updated to "DOWN" or "DRAIN" before scheduling a node state resume

reservation.description: Name of reservation containing this node

alloc_memory.description: Total memory in MB currently allocated for jobs

alloc_cpus.description: Total number of CPUs currently allocated for jobs

tres_used.description: Trackable resources currently allocated for jobs

tres_weighted.description: Ignored. Was weighted number of billable trackable resources allocated

slurmd_start_time.description: Time when the slurmd started (UNIX timestamp)

sockets.description: Number of physical processor sockets/chips on the node

threads.description: Number of logical threads in a single physical core

temporary_disk.description: Total size in MB of temporary disk storage in TmpFS

weight.description: Weight of the node for scheduling purposes

base_consumed_energy.description: The energy consumed between when the node was powered on and the last time it was registered by slurmd, in joules

consumed_energy.description: The energy consumed between the last time the node was registered by the slurmd daemon and the last node energy accounting sample, in joules

current_watts.description: The instantaneous power consumption at the time of the last node energy accounting sample, in watts

last_collected.description: Time when energy data was last retrieved (UNIX timestamp)

cpu_bind.description: Default method for binding tasks to allocated CPUs

extra.description: Arbitrary string used for node filtering if extra constraints are enabled

address.description: NodeAddr, used to establish a communication path

state.description: New state to assign to the node

reason.description: Reason for node being DOWN or DRAINING

reason_uid.description: User ID to associate with the reason (needed if user root is sending message)

resume_after.description: Number of seconds after which to automatically resume DOWN or DRAINED node

weight.description: Weight of the node for scheduling purposes

last_update.description: Time of last partition change (UNIX timestamp)

jobs.description: Maximum number of jobs allowed to oversubscribe resources

flags.description: Flags applicable to the OverSubscribe setting

resume.description: ResumeTimeout (GLOBAL if both set and infinite are false)

suspend.description: SuspendTimeout (GLOBAL if both set and infinite are false)

suspend_time.description: SuspendTime (GLOBAL if both set and infinite are false)

last_update.description: Time of last reservation change (UNIX timestamp)

accounts.description: Comma separated list of permitted accounts

time.description: If PURGE_COMP flag is set, the number of seconds this reservation will sit idle until it is revoked

tres.description: Comma separated list of required TRES

users.description: Comma separated list of permitted users

allocation_nodes.description: List of nodes allocated to the job

job_id.description: Job ID of job array, or 0 if N/A

tasks.description: Maximum number of simultaneously running tasks, 0 if no limit

task_id.description: Task ID of this task in job array

task.description: String expression of task IDs in this record

block.description: The name of the block to be used (used with Blue Gene systems)

constraints.description: Feature(s) the job requested as a constraint

container.description: Absolute path to OCI container bundle

derived_exit_code.description: Highest exit code of all job steps

eligible.description: Time when the job became eligible to run (UNIX timestamp)

planned.description: Time required to start job after becoming eligible to run in seconds

submission.description: Time when the job was submitted (UNIX timestamp)

suspended.description: Total time in suspended state in seconds

seconds.description: System CPU time used by the job in seconds

microseconds.description: System CPU time used by the job in microseconds

seconds.description: Sum of System and User CPU time used by the job in seconds

microseconds.description: Sum of System and User CPU time used by the job in microseconds

seconds.description: User CPU time used by the job in seconds

microseconds.description: User CPU time used by the job in microseconds

extra.description: Arbitrary string used for node filtering if extra constraints are enabled

failed_node.description: Name of node that caused job failure

group.description: Group ID of the user that owns the job

job_offset.description: Unique sequence number applied to this component of the heterogeneous job

label.description: Multi-Category Security label on the job

qos.description: Quality of Service assigned to the job

memory_per_cpu.description: Minimum memory in megabytes per allocated CPU

memory_per_node.description: Minimum memory in megabytes per allocated node

kill_request_user.description: User ID that requested termination of the job

restart_cnt.description: How many times this job has been requeued/restarted

script.description: Job batch script; only the first component in a HetJob is populated or honored

reason.description: Reason for previous Pending or Failed state

submit_line.description: Command used to submit the job

allocated.description: Trackable resources allocated to the job

suspended.description: Total time in suspended state in seconds

seconds.description: System CPU time used by the step in seconds

microseconds.description: System CPU time used by the step in microseconds

seconds.description: Total CPU time used by the step in seconds

microseconds.description: Total CPU time used by the step in microseconds

seconds.description: User CPU time used by the step in seconds

microseconds.description: User CPU time used by the step in microseconds

count.description: Number of nodes in the job step

range.description: Node(s) allocated to the job step

list.description: List of nodes used by the step

min.description: Minimum requested CPU frequency in kHz

max.description: Maximum requested CPU frequency in kHz

governor.description: Requested CPU frequency governor in kHz

kill_request_user.description: User ID that requested termination of the step

actual_frequency.description: Average weighted CPU frequency of all tasks in kHz

consumed.description: Total energy consumed by all tasks in a job in joules

distribution.description: The layout of the step was when it was running

max.description: Maximum TRES usage requested among all tasks

min.description: Minimum TRES usage requested among all tasks

average.description: Average TRES usage requested among all tasks

total.description: Total TRES usage requested among all tasks

max.description: Maximum TRES usage consumed among all tasks

min.description: Minimum TRES usage consumed among all tasks

average.description: Average TRES usage consumed among all tasks

total.description: Total TRES usage consumed among all tasks

allocated.description: Trackable resources allocated to the step

rpc_version.description: RPC version used in the cluster

associations.description: Associations involving this account (only populated if requested)

coordinators.description: List of users that are a coordinator of this account (only populated if requested)

organization.description: Organization to which the account belongs

direct.description: Indicates whether the coordinator was directly assigned to this account

coordinators.description: Accounts this user is a coordinator for

accounting.description: Accounting records containing related resource usage

id.description: Unique ID for this user-cluster-wckey combination
Association ID or Workload characterization key ID

start.description: When the record was started (UNIX timestamp)

flags.description: Flags, to avoid modifying current values specify NOT_SET

list.description: Other QOS's this QOS can preempt

accounting.description: Accounting records containing related resource usage

lineage.description: Complete path up the hierarchy to the root association

shares_raw.description: Allocated shares used for fairshare calculation

extra.description: Arbitrary string used for node filtering if extra constraints are enabled

time_end.description: When the instance will end (UNIX timestamp)

time_start.description: When the instance will start (UNIX timestamp)

association_condition.description: Filters to select associations for users

user.description: Admin level of user, DefaultAccount, DefaultWCKey

grpjobs.description: Maximum number of running jobs in this association and its children

grpjobsaccrue.description: Maximum number of pending jobs able to accrue age priority in this association and its children

grpsubmitjobs.description: Maximum number of jobs which can be in a pending or running state at any time in this association and its children

grptres.description: Maximum number of TRES able to be allocated by running jobs in this association and its children

grptresmins.description: Total number of TRES minutes that can possibly be used by past, present and future jobs in this association and its children

grptresrunmins.description: Maximum number of TRES minutes able to be allocated by running jobs in this association and its children

grpwall.description: Maximum wall clock time in minutes able to be allocated by running jobs in this association and its children

maxjobs.description: Maximum number of running jobs per user in this association

maxjobsaccrue.description: Maximum number of pending jobs able to accrue age priority at any given time in this association

maxsubmitjobs.description: Maximum number of jobs which can be in a pending or running state at any time in this association

maxtresminsperjob.description: Maximum number of TRES minutes each job is able to use in this association

maxtresrunmins.description: Maximum number of TRES minutes able to be allocated by running jobs in this association

maxtresperjob.description: Maximum number of TRES each job is able to use in this association

maxtrespernode.description: Maximum number of TRES each node is able to use

maxwalldurationperjob.description: Maximum wall clock time each job is able to use in this association

minpriothresh.description: Minimum priority required to reserve resources when scheduling

fairshare.description: Allocated shares used for fairshare calculation

association_condition.description: CSV list of accounts, association limits and options, CSV list of clusters

organization.description: Organization to which the account belongs

RPCs.description: List of RPCs sent to the slurmdbd

users.description: List of users that issued RPCs

count.description: Number of hourly rollups since last_run

last_run.description: Last time hourly rollup ran (UNIX timestamp)

last.description: Total time spent doing last daily rollup (seconds)

time.description: Total time spent doing hourly rollups (seconds)

count.description: Number of daily rollups since last_run

last_run.description: Last time daily rollup ran (UNIX timestamp)

last.description: Total time spent doing daily daily rollup (seconds)

time.description: Total time spent doing daily rollups (seconds)

count.description: Number of monthly rollups since last_run

last_run.description: Last time monthly rollup ran (UNIX timestamp)

last.description: Total time spent doing monthly daily rollup (seconds)

time.description: Total time spent doing monthly rollups (seconds)

average.description: Average RPC processing time in microseconds

total.description: Total RPC processing time in microseconds

total.description: Total RPC processing time in microseconds

responding.description: If ping RPC responded with pong from slurmdbd

latency.description: Number of microseconds it took to successfully ping or timeout

primary.description: Is responding slurmdbd the primary controller
